biography.content: I received my  BSc in Psychology (Honours) from Algoma University in Sault Ste. Marie, ON. While at AlgomaU I started as a volunteer research assistant in Dr. Keough's lab, conducted my honours thesis under Dr. Brodbeck's supervision, and was awarded an NSERC USRA to work in Dr. Bloomfield's lab. I started at the University of Alberta in September, 2013 as a Masterâ€™s student with Dr. Christopher Sturdy. As a graduate student in the Songbird Neuroethology Laboratory, I am primarily interested in chickadees' vocal and movement responses to varying levels of predator threat and providing further evidence for referential communication in songbirds. I am currently funded by an NSERC CGS-M.
